job.title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services (34025)
job.description:
Title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services.

About us: Myticas Consulting Group of Companies. Myticas specializes in IT Staffing and Recruitment Services with over 50 years of combined experience in the IT Staffing industry. We serve clients in all industries in the United States and Canada with offices in Ottawa, Chicago, Atlanta, Cleveland, and Grand Rapids. 

About the position: The Sr. Business Development professional will sit in our Chicago, Illinois office This position is a hybrid role and requires some travel. This position is responsible for Business Development in this area as a priority, but able to develop business in OH, PA, WV, IN, IL, etc. This position comes with a competitive salary, commission, bonus potential, medical, dental, vision, 401K, and PTO. This professional would have full access to training, access to and support from the marketing department and technical tools in support of their success. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Initiate contact, develop relationships, and conduct business development activities with clients and professionals; networking and connecting with IT professionals, executives, managers, and other professionals and resources at potential, new, and existing clients.
  • Research and qualify new clients, conducting business development activities and negotiating terms of service and agreements with new clients.
  • Provided expert level staffing support to clients, hiring managers, and professionals. Qualifying technical position requirements and coordinating with technical recruiters to fulfill staffing needs for new and existing clients.
  • Represent and market the  Myticas Consulting Group brands.
  • Participate, network at, support, and sponsor events involving the technical community.
  • Sell via telephone, face-to-face and videoconferencing.
  • Utilize Bullhorn CRM/Application tracking system for client and manager outreach and keep CRM documentation, agreements, resources, and paperwork up to date.

Required Experience:

  • 3-5 years’ demonstrated record of success selling staffing services, preferably with experience in the IT environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Outstanding customer service, integrity, and interpersonal skills.  
  • Energetic, enthusiastic, self-motivated, collaborative.
  • Passion for the staffing industry, excellent work ethic, and strong desire to succeed.

job.title: Sr Marketing Data Scientist (MMM) (33918)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Marketing Data Scientist Manager for a 6 months+ contract-to-hire opportunity.

Location: 100% REMOTE
Duration: 6 Months Contract to Hire

Title:

  • Marketing Data Science Manager

About the Role

We are seeking a Marketing Data Science Manager who can bridge the gap between data modeling and business impact. This role will focus on leveraging data science models and analytical frameworks to generate actionable marketing insights, optimize campaign performance, and guide strategic decisions.
The ideal candidate combines strong analytical and technical skills with business acumen and communication ability to translate data into meaningful narratives for stakeholders.

Requirements

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Operation Research, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Marketing Analytics etc.
  • Analytical and technical skills:
    • Proficiency (10+ years) in analyzing complex data and models, derive and deliver actionable insights to provide data driven marketing strategy to stakeholders. Strong ability to translate model outputs into business insights and marketing recommendations.
    • Proficiency (7+ years) in statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, PBI for data wrangling and modeling.
    • Familiarity (5+ years) with AWS Sagemaker and Lambda functions. Terraform experience will be preferred.
    • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Experience (required):
    • At least 10 years hands on experience in machine learning, marketing analytics, statistical modeling, marketing mix modeling.
    • At least 10 years experience with various statistical techniques such as regression analysis, time series analysis, and predictive modeling, optimization etc.
    • Familiarity (5+ years) with marketing research methodologies and tools.
  • Experience (good to have):
    • AI and multi-touch attribution model experience
    • Familiarity with ad platforms (Google Ads, DV360, etc.)
    • Experience in A/B testing or experimentation frameworks
  • Marketing Knowledge:
    • Deep understanding of marketing concepts, including advertising, distribution, and campaign strategies.
    • Familiarity with different marketing channels and their impact on business performance.
    • Knowledge of industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics.
  • Business Acumen:
    • Understanding of business objectives and how marketing analytics can support decision-making and drive business growth.
    • Ability to align marketing strategies with broader organizational goals and objectives.
  • Communication Skills:
    • Ability to communicate complex analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
    • Collaborative approach to working with cross-functional teams, including media, creative, product, and finance.

Skills

  • Proficient in machine learning model and statistical model development, simulation and optimization and deployment in AWS
  • Proficient in SQL, Python, R for data integration and modeling projects
  • Advanced in AWS Sagemaker, EC2, S3, Terraform, Bitbucket, etc for deployment projects
  • Advanced in PBI, Excel, streamlit for analytics and visualization projects
  • Experience in Terraform, EC2, MMM, optimizer application will be a big plus

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deploy predictive and statistical models to evaluate marketing performance (e.g., attribution, media mix modeling, churn, LTV, segmentation, optimization).
  • Partner with marketing, product team to translate modeling results into clear business insights & recommendations that drive growth and ROI and communicate implications to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Present findings to senior stakeholders through clear storytelling and visualization.
  • Visualize and present analytical results using tools like Power BI, Excel, etc.
  • Build and maintain scalable analytics pipelines using Python/R, SQL, and possibly cloud data platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Partner with marketing operations to operationalize insights (e.g., audience targeting, spend optimization).
  • Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to improve data accessibility and accuracy.
  • Support ongoing model performance monitoring and iterative improvements.
  • Support MMM and app maintenance and development for simulation and optimization and further development. Push changes to production using AWS Sagemaker, EC2, Terraform, Bitbucket, etc.
  • Assist with ad-hoc data requests, data exploration and building business knowledge models. Build intelligent dashboards if needed using SQL, PBI. 
  • Conduct cross-functional collaboration, stakeholder meetings and provide documentations and internal trainings.
  • Lead projects, manage timelines, and ensure deliverables meet the business objectives and are delivered on time.
  • Perform other duties as assigned or apparent.
  • Work with marketing and product teams to design experiments, measure campaign ROI, and inform strategy.

What You’ll Gain

  • Opportunity to help shape the organization’s marketing data science and insights function.
  • Direct influence on marketing strategy and customer growth initiatives.
  • Exposure to cutting-edge analytics and experimentation techniques in a data-driven culture.
  • Path to full-time employment with strong career growth opportunities.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (33597)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience


    Salary Range:  $130,000 - $260,000

job.title: SAP BASIS Administrator – Senior Consultant (33336)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly experienced Senior SAP BASIS Administrator to support a complex SAP landscape and multiple enterprise-level SAP platforms. The ideal resource will bring deep BASIS administration expertise across ECC, HANA, cloud integrations, SAP BTP, and modern SAP modules including SuccessFactors, Ariba, BW/4HANA, and Fiori.

This role requires hands-on experience across on-premise and cloud environments, system performance management, integrations, upgrades, and support of mission-critical SAP systems.

 

Required Experience & Qualifications

The resource must demonstrate the following:

Core SAP Technical Expertise

  • 15+ years as an SAP BASIS Administrator

  • 10+ years working with SAP ECC 6 or higher

  • 4+ years working with RHEL/HANA environments

SAP Cloud, Integration & Application Experience

  • 2+ years with SAP SuccessFactors (Recruiting + Employee Central)

  • 4+ years with SAP Ariba

  • 2+ years with SAP CIG and SAP CPI

  • 2+ years with SAP Fiori

  • 3+ years with SAP PI 7.5, including hands-on PI development

Platform & Administration Tools

  • 5+ years with SAP Solution Manager, including 2+ years with SolMan 7.2

  • 5+ years with SAP Enterprise Portal 7.5

  • Experience with SAML-based SSO in SAP environments

SAP Data & Cloud Platform

  • 2+ years with SAP BW/4HANA and BPC

  • 2+ years managing SAP BTP global accounts and subaccounts

  • 2+ years administering SAP BTP services such as:

  • SAP Integration Suite

  • IAS/IPS

  • Cloud ALM

Other Requirements

  • 6+ months experience with AI in SAP (e.g., SAP AI Core, AI services, AI-based monitoring or automation)

Preferred Attributes

  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

  • Experience in public-sector environments

  • Excellent communication and documentation abilities

  • Ability to work collaboratively across technical and functional teams

job.title: Senior Database Administrator (33988)

Equipment & Access Requirem

job.title: Data Analyst / Developer (Power BI & Microsoft Fabric) (34507)
job.description:

This role requires strong hands-on experience with Power BI, Fabric, API integrations, and Copilot Studio.

Key Responsibilities

  • Implement secure, authenticated API refresh using OAuth2/API keys, including pagination, throttling, REST integrations, and on-prem gateway configurations.

  • Manage Power BI end-to-end for the Cyber division (semantic modeling, DAX, UX, performance tuning, lineage, governance).

  • Build high-impact Power BI & Microsoft Fabric solutions including trusted data ingestion, semantic modeling, and optimized reporting.

  • Leverage Copilot in Power BI for accelerated report creation and insight generation.

  • Promote responsible AI practices: grounding, evaluation, data readiness, and user enablement.

  • Provide SME guidance, knowledge transfer, and coaching to internal Cyber teams.

  • Support additional analytics and reporting activities as required.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years advanced experience with Power BI modeling, DAX, performance analyzer & governance.

  • 5+ years experience with API literacy for analytics (OAuth2, pagination, throttling, secure refresh).

  • 2+ years hands-on experience in Microsoft Fabric (Workspaces, Notebooks, Pipelines, OneLake, SQL Analytics).

  • 2+ years experience designing Copilot Studio agents and integrating with Power Automate, Dataverse, and Microsoft Graph.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience as a technical lead in a Power BI or Fabric Community of Practice.

  • Strong stakeholder engagement across multiple levels.

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34282)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Define requirements, select components, and contribute to schematic/board design decisions.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Senior RF Test Engineer (33471)
job.description:
The Senior RF Test Engineer will be responsible for developing and maintaining system verification and validation plans of the communication system. In addition, they will participate in the various testing activities across systems with vendors and other partners and responsible for maintaining the lab.


Main Responsibilities
  • In this role, the incumbent will issue recommendations and have influence on the system verification and validation.
  • Work with various Antenna Vendors to support the SOW, SRR, Test Requirements, Test Plans, Test Results and RVTM reviews, in addition to follow up on the integrate of the Antenna with the other components (Modem, and other interfaces).
  • Work with the other segments to support the development of the internal Test Plans and verification methods.
  • Support Over The Air (OTA) Test Planning and activities including the Test automation processes.
  • Support System Acceptance Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Develop system and sub system verification matrices against system requirements
  • Coordinate and participate in RF and system level testing activities including test planning, execution and reporting
  • Serve as an RF expert and support other technical staff as required
  • Plays an active role in component and subsystem design and test activities
  • Configuring test equipment like Satellite Link Emulators, signal generator, spectrum analyzer etc.
  • Ensure product under test meets technical, functional, performance and business requirements
  • Keep the lab functional and update to date with known hardware and software configuration to execute various test scenarios as necessary
  • Work with partners and other vendors in various test campaigns
Education & Experience Required
  • B. S or M.S.in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 20 years of relevant experience in satellite communications
  • 10+ years of work experience in different antenna types like Flat Panel Antenna, Parabolic and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • 10+ years of work experience in Satellite RF communication systems with strong exposure on modulation and coding used in modern standards like DVB-S2(X) and DVB-RCS2
  • Hands on experience using RF test equipment (Oscilloscopes, Signal Generators, Spectrum Analyzers, satellite channel emulator)
  • Strong understanding of RF engineering Principles and Design Practices
  • Demonstrated understanding of air interfaces, modem technologies, modulation and coding and its impact on the satellite link performance
  • Experience with satellite link budget analyses with good understanding of effects of impairments on the link performance
  • Experience in test case and defect tracking tools (Jira, Jama)
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with management, engineering teams and partners / suppliers
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with different Ka band antenna vendors
  • Experience with Flat Panel Antenna and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • Experience with BUC/LNB and various Antenna technologies
  • Experience in Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Proficient with MATLAB, python.
  • Highly collaborative team player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Salary Range - $95,000 - $135,000

job.title: Senior Embedded Developer - Principal (32925)
job.description:
Principal Embedded Software Developer will play a pivotal role in driving the architectural and design aspects of our software projects.
They will collaborate closely with System Engineering and other cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with our organizational objectives and be a technical lead within the Scrum Team, guiding and influencing the team's decisions to achieve optimal outcomes. In addition, they will lead technical discussions with our valued vendors and partners, fostering strong relationships and provide vital day-to-day guidance to team members, promoting a cohesive and productive work environment.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of embedded application software, board support software and OS integration
    • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define architecture, technical specifications, and software requirements for ground segment systems.
    • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the engineering team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
    • Architect software solutions that adhere to Test-Driven Development (TDD) principles and utilize simulated software to rigorously test code functionality.
    • Design software with a profound understanding of hardware resource limitations to ensure optimal performance in resource-constrained environments.
    • Stay current with the latest advancements in satellite technology and industry trends, driving innovation and maintaining technical excellence.
    • Implement and support MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Guide the team in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of ground segment software.
    • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
    • Utilize expertise in cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization to optimize software deployment and management.
    • Leverage software modeling tools to create robust and efficient software architectures.
    • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, helping to evolve development processes, tools, and methodologies.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
    • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 10 + years of experience in software development, focusing on satellite communication systems.
Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
    • Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems)
    • Experience programming with at least one or more programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, Golang, PowerShell
    • Deep understanding of satellite technology, ground segment operations, and associated challenges.
    • Good understanding of networking and routing protocols 
    • Experience supporting and implementing MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.
    • Strong problem-solving skills, capable of addressing intricate technical challenges.
    • Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
    • Familiarity with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and simulated software testing methodologies.
    • Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints.
    • Experience with cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization.
    • Proficiency in using software modeling tools to create robust architectures.
    • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
    • Experience working with geographically dispersed teams.

job.title: UX Designer (33633)
job.description:
• Leads discovery activities to understand users, define audience segments, and map end-to-end customer journeys that inform product strategy.

  • Conducts qualitative and quantitative research (interviews, usability sessions, behavioral studies) to surface user needs, pain points, and opportunity areas.

  • Translates research findings into actionable artifacts such as personas, journey maps, workflow diagrams, and experience recommendations.

  • Evaluates existing digital products—especially B2B applications—to identify UX gaps, workflow friction, and optimization opportunities.

  • Applies Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) principles to ensure intuitive interaction patterns and user-centred design decisions.

  • Leverages analytics and research tools (e.g., GA4, Hotjar, insight platforms) to validate assumptions, detect behavioral patterns, and support data-driven decisions.

  • Uses collaborative design tools (Figma, Miro, etc.) to prototype concepts, facilitate workshops, and guide cross-functional teams through ideation and solutioning.

  • Communicates research insights, concepts, and design rationale clearly to stakeholders to ensure shared alignment across discovery and delivery phases.

  • Partners with marketing/brand teams to incorporate visual identity and brand expression into user experiences.

  • Synthesizes complex data into clear experience frameworks, demonstrating creativity, strong organization, and attention to detail while staying current with UX industry practices.

job.title: Senior RF Systems Engineer (33470)
job.description:
Senior RF Systems Engineering Specialist – Satellite Communications

This role requires deep technical expertise in satellite RF communications, with a strong focus on physical layer and Layer 2 system design. A solid working knowledge of Layer 3 and higher protocols is also expected. The successful candidate will bring extensive experience with DVB-S2, DVB-S2X, and DVB-RCS2 standards, along with a strong foundation in RF and digital communications theory.

You will have hands-on experience with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) techniques and a strong understanding of modern antenna technologies, including active and phased array systems. This includes digital beamforming, rapid beam hopping, and antenna performance modelling. The role operates within a systems engineering framework, requiring familiarity with requirements management and the full lifecycle from concept through verification.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze and review RF link budgets, conduct system-level trade studies, and model signal impairments to evaluate overall communications performance.

  • Collaborate closely with system architects, RF, antenna, and earth station engineers to allocate functionality between hardware and software while optimizing system performance.

  • Develop and maintain high-level requirements and specifications for RF links, RF subsystems, and antenna systems, including managing requirement updates as designs evolve.

  • Define, review, and assess test plans, procedures, and results to verify compliance with system specifications.

  • Perform system performance characterization and analysis, maintaining detailed performance budgets for assigned system elements.

  • Provide technical expertise in support of regulatory, spectrum coordination, and market access activities.

  • Mentor junior engineers and serve as a technical resource for team members with developing domain expertise.

  • Prepare and deliver technical presentations to internal and external engineering audiences as required.

Education and Experience

  • Master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, with a focus on RF, antenna and microwave engineering, digital communications, or digital signal processing.

  • Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience performing system-level RF or satellite communications engineering.

  • Proven experience with digital communication systems, including spread-spectrum and single- and multi-carrier architectures.

  • Strong background in modulation schemes such as PSK, APSK, and QAM.

  • Direct experience with DVB-S2X, DVB-RCS2, and Adaptive Coding and Modulation techniques.

  • Demonstrated capability in modelling RF communication systems using advanced tools such as MATLAB, Python, or equivalent environments.

Skills and Competencies

  • Strong collaborator who performs effectively in cross-functional engineering teams.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • High standards for technical quality, accuracy, and documentation.

  • Capable of managing multiple complex technical challenges concurrently.

If you want, I can also:

  • Make it more concise

  • Adjust the tone (more corporate, more technical, or more startup-style)

  • Reformat it for LinkedIn, an RFP, or a careers page


    Salary Range - $110,000 - $140,000

job.title: Embedded Software Developer (32938)
job.description:
In this role, Senior Embedded Software Developer will assume ownership of specific software modules, overseeing their development, quality, and functionality. 
As an integral part of our scrum team, this role will contribute to the design, development/coding and testing of our cutting edge Software by actively engaging with both the test and support teams to ensure comprehensive testing and efficient bug resolution. In addition, you will take the lead in technical discussions and guide decision-making processes and lead and document technical discussions.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications.
    • Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages like C++ and Python.
    • Assist in the implementation of networking solutions, ensuring seamless communication between software components.
    • Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency.
    • Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to enhance code quality and adherence to coding standards.
    • Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.
    • Support the integration of software components on Linux operating systems.
    • Assist in the testing and validation of software features, ensuring functionality and performance meet specified requirements.
    • Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions.
    • Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks.
    • Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing. Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
    • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 8+ year software development experience in embedded system (Linux, ARM cores) with experience in software and firmware upgrades and device commissioning (YANG).
    • 8+ year experience in developing and troubleshooting low level application services which interface to devices through hardware interface.
    • 8+ year experience in developing software using modern C/ C++.
    • Good understanding of L1/L2 networking protocols (IPSEC, MACsec, secure tunnel), NETCONF.
    • Experience with platform module for platform security.
    • SW development in the satellite communication systems is a plus.
    • Working experience with Agile scrum methodology.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (3 Positions) (34281)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant (34053)
job.description:
Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant
STSI is looking for a Cyber Security Consultant who is detail oriented with a willingness to utilize their investigative mind and dig into remediation issues, conduct security audits, and implement change plans in IT & OT environments. Ideal candidates have experience assessing security and PLC controls with experience conducting security audits, maintaining up to date understanding of guidance from the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), and have a firm understanding and experience with Allen Bradley PLC and Modbus PLC universal communication protocol.

Type: Full-time Contract - W2 ONLY, accepting candidate that are a US Citizen (nonnegotiable)
Compensation: $ 50.00 USD to 60.00 USD
# of Positions: 3-5
Location: Richmond, VA and Glen Allen, VA
Travel: 80% - 100% - accepting only local candidates in the state of Virginia who are able to drive/go to different locations/offices in VA. Consultants will use their own vehicle and must have a valid driver's license.
Expense: Miles, Hotel (when required), food are reimbursed expenses.
Schedule: Daylight, Monday through Friday.
Reports to: Director of Network & Endpoint Security, Project Manager & Delivery Lead

Position Summary:
The Cybersecurity Consultant will independently execute significant portions of projects addressing Information Technology (IT) and Industrial Control System security. The Cybersecurity Consultant supports the execution of projects consisting of network penetration testing, web application security testing, cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, secure system design and integration, and/or development of cybersecurity programs at client sites across the U.S and Canada utilizing the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF), and other industry or data specific compliance frameworks and regulations. Execute the planning, design, development and implementation of technical controls, procedures and policy associated with cybersecurity compliance and/or regulatory standards.


Responsibilities:
  • Maintain highest level of integrity, protecting the confidentiality and security of all clients and project information.
  • Identify and diagnose operational issues and implement design alterations to address these issues.
  • Conduct network penetration tests and vulnerability assessments of IT and Operational Technology (OT) networks, for both compliance and security purposes.
  • Perform detailed, post event analysis of unusual events, and direct needed procedure or process changes in response.
  • Pursue, obtain, and maintain industry recognized IT certifications related to cybersecurity such as ethical hacking, network engineering, Industrial Control System (ICS), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA), risk management, and others as necessary.
  • Resolve technical issues, analyze implications to the client's business, and be able to communicate them with applicable stakeholders within the business.
  • Develop policies & procedures for secure process control network design, technical and design recommendations for the implementation of firewalls and other network security and compliance controls.
  • Compiles technical documentation of network traffic as well as firewall services/solutions including explanations and diagrams.
  • Work collaboratively with other groups and divisions inside the company.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Comply with all policies and standards.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field and min 3 years of related/relevant experience is Required.
  • Advanced knowledge of security principles and firm knowledge of cybersecurity technologies, as well as industry-recognized certifications.
  • Experience with cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and the tools/techniques involved in both.
  • Experience in the capabilities and/or configuration of cybersecurity controls, specifically those relating to firewalls, access control, authentication, anti-virus/anti-malware, patching, and logging.
  • Advanced knowledge of control systems utilized by utilities, manufacturing, oil and gas, transportation, smart buildings, and cities.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Ability to operate under pressure and under tight deadlines, to operate in on-site industrial, corporate, and government work.
  • Demonstrate capability to make sound decisions based on good security practices and principles.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of business principles and operational security practices specific to engineering and/or security consulting.
  • Knowledge and/or experience with corporate policies and procedures.
  • Strong technical writing skills. Knowledge and experience with modern and legacy computer networking and telecommunications.
  • Experience with physical cabling for network communications and control system Input/Output.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain access to current and future client sites.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Excel & Automation Consultant (34595)
job.description:
Excel & Automation Solutions Consultant – Operational Excellence

Overview

The Operational Excellence team is seeking an experienced Excel and automation specialist to support the design, development, and sustainment of analytical and operational tools. The team is composed of highly skilled Industrial Engineers who excel in process analysis, data interpretation, and solution design, but who require dedicated technical expertise to build scalable, maintainable tools.

This role focuses on accelerating tool development, improving usability and maintainability, and advising on when Excel is no longer the appropriate long-term platform. The consultant will act as a trusted technical partner, enabling Industrial Engineers to focus on core analytical and business-facing responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities

Tool Development & Enhancement

  • Translate business and analytical requirements into structured, maintainable tools.

  • Design, build, and enhance Excel-based tools using:

    • Advanced formulas

    • VBA (where appropriate and justified)

    • Power Query and Power Pivot

    • Microsoft 365 automation tools such as Power Automate or Power Apps

  • Create intuitive, user-friendly interfaces including dashboards, forms, and error-proof input structures.

  • Ensure tools are designed for long-term sustainability and usability by non-technical users.

  • Fully document tools to support maintenance and knowledge transfer.

Technology Assessment & Recommendations

  • Evaluate when Excel is sufficient and when alternative technologies are more appropriate.

  • Recommend solutions such as Power Apps, low-code platforms, SharePoint lists, lightweight web tools, or custom ETL where applicable.

  • Base recommendations on:

    • Maintainability

    • Total cost of ownership

    • Expected lifespan of the tool

    • User base size and complexity

Advisory & Coaching

  • Serve as a go-to technical advisor for Industrial Engineers during tool design.

  • Provide guidance on best practices and maintainability thresholds.

  • Help engineers recognize when requirements exceed Excel’s practical capabilities.

  • Propose and establish design standards, templates, and frameworks for future tool development.

  • Recommend an approach for long-term support and ownership of tools within the organization.

Maintenance & Ongoing Support

  • Troubleshoot issues identified after tools are deployed.

  • Implement small enhancements or refinements based on user feedback.

  • Transfer knowledge to designated internal owners to ensure continuity.

Initial Priority Tool Areas

The consultant will initially support tools such as:

  • Batching Analysis Tool
    An Excel-based planning tool converting annual collection plans into production plans, identifying capacity and scheduling gaps. Requires structural improvements, enhanced UI, error-proofing, and expansion to additional production types.

  • Time-Study Database
    A centralized repository for national time-study data, requiring improved data structure, reporting capability, and a modern user interface potentially beyond Excel.

  • Storage Space Calculator
    A tool to model site storage capacities and highlight utilization improvements, requiring clearer messaging, improved UI, and assessment of backend data capture and maintenance.

Additional tools may be added as business needs evolve.

Deliverables

  • Fully functional, documented tools ready for production use.

  • Architecture and technology recommendations outlining Excel versus alternative solutions.

  • Documentation packages including:

    • User guides

    • Technical explanations of logic, formulas, and automation

    • Maintenance instructions

  • Design standards and templates for future tool development.

  • Monthly summary reports detailing work completed, issues addressed, and improvement recommendations.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Proven expertise in advanced Excel, VBA, and data automation.

  • Experience developing tools for non-technical end users.

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Power Platform technologies.

  • Ability to translate business needs into clear technical solutions.

  • Demonstrated experience documenting tools for long-term maintainability.

  • Experience supporting Industrial Engineering or Operational Excellence teams is preferred.

Engagement Details

  • Duration: Initial 3–6 month engagement with option to extend.

  • Time Commitment: Approximately 10–20 hours per week, flexible based on demand.

  • Work Arrangement: Hybrid or remote, with periodic on-site meetings as required.

  • Collaboration: Close interaction with Industrial Engineers, business stakeholders, and end users.

Success Measures

  • Reduced time spent by engineers on Excel troubleshooting and tool development.

  • Faster delivery of functional tools to internal customers.

  • Stable, user-friendly, and maintainable tools.

  • Improved satisfaction from internal stakeholders.

  • Clear guidance on when and how to move beyond Excel.

  • Adoption of consistent standards that improve tool quality.

Out of Scope

  • Large-scale software development.

  • Full enterprise application rebuilds.
    This role focuses on department-level analytical and operational tooling.

job.title: AI Developer (34637)
job.description:
We are searching for people who have experience building advanced AI systems that power intelligent automation, telecom-scale data solutions, and next-generation network tools. You will work on cutting-edge generative AI, prompt engineering, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures, helping teams integrate and scale AI capabilities across key product lines. This role blends software engineering excellence with deep AI model experience in real-world applications.

What You’ll Do

  • Design, build, and deploy AI-driven solutions using Java and Python in production environments.

  • Develop Generative AI applications that leverage large language models and neural frameworks.

  • Lead the creation and optimization of RAG workflows (vector search, retrieval services, embedded search).

  • Craft and refine prompts to ensure high-quality, context-aware interactions from language models.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (data engineering, architecture, product stakeholders).

  • Implement scalable APIs, microservices, and modular model components.

  • Integrate AI solutions across cloud platforms and distributed systems.

  • Contribute to performance testing, validation, deployment, and model monitoring.
    This structure reflects responsibilities found in AI-oriented roles on similar career sites.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Machine Learning, or related field.

  • Strong software engineering experience with Java and/or Python.

  • Demonstrated experience building or integrating Generative AI models.

  • Knowledgeable in RAG approaches, including embeddings and vector database integration.

  • Practical prompt engineering experience with major LLM platforms or frameworks.

  • Familiarity with modern AI/ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain).

  • Comfortable with APIs, REST, microservices, containers (Docker, Kubernetes).

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.
    This skill set reflects what AI and ML-centered job postings commonly require.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with ML engineering best practices (MLOps, model CI/CD pipelines).

  • Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

  • Knowledge of vector search engines or embedding databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus).

  • Telecom or large-enterprise system integration experience.

  • Exposure to large-scale data pipelines and distributed systems.

job.title: Art Director (34583)
job.description:
Job Title: Art Director
Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We cannot accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.
Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s
Pay: Negotiable
Hours: Part-Time, 20 hours/week - Flexible work time
Location: ON-SITE, Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only


We are seeking a Part-Time Art Director to play a critical role in driving brand continuity and creative excellence across the entire organization. This individual will collaborate with internal teams and external agency partners to ensure all creative work aligns with brand standards and delivers a cohesive customer experience.
The Art Director will flex across the full creative development process—from shaping brand strategy to overseeing final delivery tactics. This role will touch every aspect of the business, including product brands, go-to-market campaigns, education and training, sales, and recognition programs. By connecting the dots across these areas, you will help improve the return on creative investment and amplify the impact of our creative efforts across brands and channels.

Key Responsibilities

• Brand Stewardship: Maintain and enforce brand standards across all creative outputs, ensuring consistency and continuity throughout the organization.
• Creative Development: Contribute to ideation, concept development, and execution of campaigns, assets, and experiences that span multiple touchpoints.
• Cross-Organizational Collaboration: Work closely with teams across product marketing, education, sales, and recognition to deliver integrated creative solutions.
• Agency Partnership: Collaborate with external agencies to ensure alignment with brand strategy and creative objectives.
• Customer Experience Alignment: Help connect creative efforts across channels to create a seamless and impactful customer journey.
• Strategic Input: Provide creative insights during brand and campaign strategy discussions, translating them into compelling visual executions.
• Performance Impact: Drive creative solutions that improve engagement, strengthen brand equity, and maximize ROI on creative investments.

Qualifications

• Experience: 7–10 years in marketing or communications, preferably within an internal corporate creative team.
• Creative Expertise: Deep understanding of brand systems, visual identity, and multi-channel creative execution.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud software (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere), Figma, and presentation tools (PowerPoint, Keynote).
• Ability to work across the creative process—from strategy to production.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience influencing cross-functional teams.
• Experience managing external creative partners is a plus.

What We Offer

• Flexible part-time schedule.
• Internal creative project managers will coordinate schedules, rounds of review, and proof timing.
• 20-25 hours per week.
• Opportunity to work on diverse brands and projects across the organization.
• Collaborative and creative work environment.

job.title: Senior Network Architect (33473)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.


The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the  Network design and works with other teams within and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the program.

Main Responsibilities

  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies fornetwork equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

job.title: Senior UI/UX Designer (34658)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Senior UI/UX Designer for a 6+ months contract.  This is an On-Site role.  The job details are below.  Qualified candidates, please provide resume.  Thank you!

Senior UI/UX Designer
Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. 
Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s
Pay: $55-60/hr  
Hours:  Monday-Friday, 40hrs.8-5pm, On-Site
Location: Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only

As a Senior Designer, you will turn ambiguous problems into shipped, measurable outcomes.  You lead the design for a product or pod, bridging the gap between user needs, business strategy and engineering feasibility.  You raise the bar for the entire design organization.  

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategic Discovery:  Lead discovery to define problems and user needs.  Translate insights into clear product opportunities and testable hypotheses.  

End-to-End Execution:  Design high-quality accessible interfaces (Web/iOS/Android) and user flows that move the needle on KPI's like activation and task success. 

AI-Augmented Workflow:  Leverage generative AI tools to accelerate ideation, automate repetitive tasks and synthesize large-scale research data.

System Ownership:  Evolve our design system (tokens, components, patterns); drive adoption and governance across platforms with "accessibility by default."

Technical Collaboration: Partner deeply with Engineering and PM's to refine requirements, navigate technical constraints and ensure high-quality Design QA. 

Leadership & Mentorship:  Elevate team standards through critiques and documented decision-making; mentor med/junior designers in craft and strategy.  

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Product Thinking:  Ability to link design decisions directly to business models and success metrics (CSAT, North Star metrics). 

Expert-level proficiency in Figma, including Auto Layout 6.0, Multi-mode Variables (for theming, localization, and accessibility), and logic-driven prototyping using conditional variables and expressions to simulate production-ready app behavior. 

AI Literacy:  Proficiency in AI-driven design tools (Figma, AI/Make) for rapid wireframing and UI exploration. 

Research Synthesis:  Ability to use AI tools (e.g. Co-Pilot) to distill user interviews and feedback into actionable themes.

Job Summary

The Estimator plays a key role in driving project success by delivering accurate, detailed cost estimates for custom fixtures, millwork, and accessories. Using a component‑driven system, you’ll collaborate closely with engineering, sales, and project management to develop cost‑effective, practical design solutions for both standard and highly customized applications.

job.title: Software Architect (34574)

  • Produce and maintain clear technical documentation for both internal and external audiences.

Education & Professional Background

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a closely related discipline.

  • Significant hands-on experience in software development.

  • Proven background in a technical leadership, senior engineering, or architectural capacity.

  • Proficiency in Java, Python, and C++.

  • Experience operating within Agile delivery frameworks.

Additional Qualifications

  • Excellent written and verbal communication capabilities.

  • Ability to present ideas clearly to leadership, engineering peers, and external partners.

job.title: Network/Fiber Planning Engineer (34654)
job.description:
Fiber Planning Engineer
Conshohocken, PA (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $49.50 - $66.00

Description:
Our Transmission & Distribution global practice is looking for a Fiber Planning Engineer to work as part of the FirstEnergy Fiber Replacement Program (FRP) Team. This FRP team will help FirstEnergy manage a large-scale, multi-year portfolio of fiber rebuild projects, affecting topology of MPLS, SONET, and DWDM networks. In this role, the candidate will guide internal network architecture, fiber planning/routing, and fiber execution efforts.

Responsibilities:
  • Assess existing and future transport solutions utilizing design tools such as GIS. Transport solutions will be determined based upon location type, substation size, remote access requirements, etc.
  • Attend weekly client fiber project review sessions, participate in quarterly network planning, and implement coordination meetings.
  • Coordinate with GIS team on documentation of logical schematic and geographic network designs for systems including, but not limited to MPLS, DWDM, and SONET.
  • Work with network design engineering on integrating fiber designs into network design packages. Provide guidance to design team on transport solutions and network topology.
  • Coordinate FRP buildout plans with the FirstEnergy Portfolio Development lead to develop schedule and budgets.
  • Assist in the creation and submission of Fiber Optic Work Requests (FOWR), the review of fiber cost estimates, and quality review of fiber design packages. Review fiber scope & estimation proposals to ensure technical and constructability criteria are met.
  • Assist in the documentation of fiber initiatives and processes, including process documentation updates and deliverables to the client, “How To” guides, etc.
  • Participate in site visits to assess existing substation control house conditions and confirm new equipment needs. Additional investigation of distribution lines along fiber route may be required.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or related degree from an ABET accredited program and min 3 years of electrical engineering experience (consulting preferred) is Required – OR – Bachelor Degree in Electrical or related Engineering Technology from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam and min 3 years of electrical engineering experience (consulting preferred) is Required – OR – Master Degree in Electrical Engineering and min 2 years of electrical engineering experience (consulting preferred) is Required.
  • Experience with utility experience or fiber network design experience is required.
  • Must be a self-starter and highly motivated to continually learn new technical skillsets and grow as a network engineer.
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Must be capable of applying intensive and diversified knowledge of principles and practices to broad areas of assignments.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a vast array of information.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. job.title: 100% remote Senior Salesforce Platform Engineer (33707)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking a Sr. Salesforce Platform Engineer.

Duration: 1 Year Contract (possible further extension).

ONLY W2 Contract: MUST be a US Citizen who is able/willing to work on W2 Contract ONLY.
 

Top skills/competencies required for this position:

  1. Must have experience in Salesforce security Model.
  2. Must have experience in Salesforce Integration patterns.
  3. Must have experience in Salesforce Flow optimization.
  4. Must have experience with the overall Salesforce platform and delivering Salesforce solutions from design to production.
  5. Experience in Data Cloud is preferred.
 

Job Description:
The Platform Engineer performs a critical role delivering the core capabilities and features of a strategic platform. This position will be responsible for the delivery of platform enablers including the design, build, security and operationalization of reusable components in support of business products. The Platform Engineer is expected to maintain deep technical knowledge of capabilities and features to create platform patterns and technical best-practices with the goal of increasing adoption, operational efficiency, and realized business value for client and Financial Services. The level of work required is considered advanced.

Platform Lifecycle:

  • Drive design, engineering, implementation, and configuration of platform services to support overall enterprise patterns, and reinforcing best practices.
  • Develop patterns for common platform needs (e.g. logging, monitoring, alerting, backup, encryption, tooling, etc) across all layers of the platform and supporting services.
  • Deliver explicit APIs and abstractions that offer flexibility for application developers in leveraging the platform.
  • Works with business and technology partners to identify, define, interpret, and clarify scope of the Salesforce platform integrations.
  • Partner with Information Security representatives to develop, implement and/or execute security configurations and controls.
  • Support and refine the utilization strategy for the platform and enhance its overall architecture, security, performance, and financial aspects.
  • Contribute to platform, product, and architectural roadmaps Platform Administration.
  • Performs development of common Salesforce platform components, capabilities, and features.
  • Performs development and advanced configuration activities including custom objects and fields, dashboards, reports, workflows, rules, automations, and triggers.
  • Experience with SalesForce screen flow and login flow.
  • Creates Integrations and/or Connectors between Salesforce.com and FRS and other 3rd party applications.
  • Manages the core security model configurations in accordance with information security.

Operational Excellence:
  • Provide Tier 3 Support for core platform services and configuration defect resolution.
  • Performs new Salesforce release evaluations and assess impact.
  • Develops and maintains automation for deployments to reduce manual processes and improve efficiencies across systems and data centers.
  • Leads solution design discussions, develops work effort estimates for implementation and presents solutions.
  • Drafts and maintains solution documentation for platform components, integrations, and common use patterns to meet all architectural, security and operational requirements.
  • Provides training, coaching and support for issues relating to the Salesforce platform to experience and product team.

Experience Background:
  • Experience in the CRM, Customer Support, Sales and Marketing domain.
  • Experience with the overall Salesforce platform and working knowledge of Salesforce integration approaches.
  • Experience delivering Salesforce solutions from design to production.
  • Experience integrating Salesforce with 3rd party solutions.
  • Experience engineering solutions across a heterogenous datacenter, cloud, and SaaS environments.
  • Experience using standard development practices.
  • Experience with change management systems and processes.
  • Experience in troubleshooting, diagnosis, and problem solving.
  • Experience with scripting languages (power shell or shell scripting).
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and processes (Gitlab).
  • Platform certification is a plus.
  • Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) highly desired.
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • 5 plus years of direct work-related experience.

Top 3 soft skills:
  • Collaboration/Teamwork.
  • Adaptability (adjusts to changes in priorities).
  • Critical Thinking (applies objective analysis and reasoning).

  • Review schedules, budgets and project criteria and apply to civil design and layouts.

Requirements:

job.title: SAP Technical Analyst (34615)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of an SAP Technical Analyst for a contract or contract-to-hire opportunity.  This positon will require on-site work in Grand Rapids, MI.  Candidates local or willing to relocate should apply.  

TITLE:  SAP S/4 Technical Analyst
TERM: 10+ Months Contract or Contract-to-Hire
TYPE:  W2 or C2C
RATE:  Negotiable
LOCATION:  Grand Rapids, MI - ON-SITE work required
Candidates willing to relocate will be considered

Technical Analyst
We are looking for a technical analyst with primarily SAP S/4 experience to contribute to the objectives of our global team and its ongoing projects. In this role, you will apply Agile methodologies to facilitate the efficient delivery of robust SAP S/4 technical solutions, that advance cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
The team you will be part of    
 
We are a global team managing the migration from SAP ECC to S/4 to support manufacturing, distribution, and logistics. Our versatile members ensure smooth transition and ongoing ECC technical support, working collaboratively to achieve team objectives and align with company goals.
 
Primary Responsibilities
 
As a technical analyst, your responsibilities will include:
·Interpreting functional specifications and translating them into implementable and supportable technical solutions
·Developing technical specifications utilizing standardized templates
·Creating and maintaining comprehensive technical documentation
·Conducting research on S/4 platform best practices to address business process requirements
·Collaborating with technical developers to ensure deliverables meet business requirements and expectations
·Unit testing developed solutions
·Troubleshooting business and technical processes on platforms such as SAP ECC, S/4, and .Net
·Applying minor ABAP code enhancements and SAP configuration
·Applying Agile methodologies and principles throughout the entire development lifecycle
·Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of emerging technologies and proactively sharing innovative ideas for process improvement
·Providing support for end-user requests or issues through the incident reporting tool, ServiceNow
 
Knowledge and Skills
·Experience in SAP S/4
·Experience in SAP S/4 modules PPDS, EWM, and/or TM
·Experience in maintaining SAP system configuration (SPRO)
·Experience in SAP ECC a plus
·Experience with Agile methodologies and concepts
·Experience in debugging transactions, ABAP programs, and function modules
·Experience in writing ABAP code a plus
·Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint
·Knowledgeable in all aspects of ABAP development, including reports, enhancements, interfaces, function modules, workflows, and classes
·Knowledgeable in Fiori, SAPUI5, CDS views, OData technologies, APIs, Cloud Platform, HANA DB, and implementing or extending standard SAP Fiori applications
·Knowledgeable in BADIs, enhancement points, BAPIs, IDOCs, and Web Services
·Knowledgeable in Discreet Manufacturing a plus
·Knowledgeable in Make to Order (MTO) a plus
·Knowledgeable in manufacturing BOMs and Routings a plus
·Knowledgeable with Azure DevOps (ADO) a plus
 
Who you are
 
·Build strong relationships and communicate clearly and effectively with diverse team members
·Demonstrate a strong work ethic, share knowledge, achieve goals, and meet deadlines
·Apply solid problem-solving and analytical abilities
·Adaptable, as team members must work in modules/areas of S/4 and ECC that they are not familiar with
·Facilitate data-driven discussions and decisions
·Support projects that enhance business capabilities
·Tackle complex system challenges with intuitive thinking
·Stay updated on system methods, emerging technologies, and best practices
·Focus on serving the team, customers, IT, and Steelcase
·Collaborate with cross-functional, global teams
·Lead and teach others empathetically

job.title: FPGA Engineering Manager (34295)
job.description:
FPGA Engineering Manager

Overview:
Our client is seeking an experienced FPGA Engineering Manager to lead the design and delivery of next-generation broadcast and video processing technology. This individual will oversee a multidisciplinary team of FPGA, software, and verification engineers to ensure innovation, quality, and timely delivery across complex hardware development programs. The role combines hands-on technical leadership with team management and strategic planning.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead and mentor FPGA, software, and verification engineers through design, development, integration, and release cycles.
• Define FPGA architecture and development methodologies aligned with product and business goals.
• Drive execution of FPGA design, verification, and integration to ensure quality and performance targets are met.
• Establish and enforce best practices for design reviews, coding standards, and continuous integration workflows.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware, software, and product management, to deliver cohesive solutions.
• Evaluate new FPGA technologies, EDA tools, and verification methodologies to enhance productivity and design quality.
• Participate in technical discussions, design reviews, and planning sessions to align development with the overall technology roadmap.

Leadership & Team Management:
• Supervise engineering staff, including task planning, progress tracking, and performance reviews.
• Promote a collaborative and accountable culture focused on technical excellence and innovation.
• Support recruitment, onboarding, and professional development of technical staff.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering (or equivalent).
• 10+ years of experience in FPGA or high-speed digital design.
• Strong background in FPGA architecture, serial interfaces, and high-speed protocols (e.g., DDR, PCIe, Ethernet, HDMI, DisplayPort, SDI).
• Proficiency with FPGA design and verification tools (Xilinx Vivado, Intel Quartus, ModelSim/QuestaSim) and scripting languages (Python, Tcl, Bash).
• Experience with lab debugging tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, JTAG, etc.).
• Proven leadership in managing multidisciplinary engineering teams and driving product delivery.
• Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

job.title: MLOps Consultant, Senior (33827)
job.description:
Senior MLOps Consultant (Agentic AI Engineering Delivery)

Overview

Our client, a leading organization in the banking sector, is seeking a Senior MLOps Consultant with proven, hands-on experience building and deploying production-grade Agentic AI systems. This role is deeply technical, requiring strong software engineering and platform delivery expertise rather than QA or oversight. The ideal candidate has built and shipped complex ML/AI systems leveraging MLOps best practices and modern GenAI frameworks.

This consultant will be instrumental in designing, automating, and scaling ML and GenAI workloads within secure, enterprise-grade environments—combining MLOps engineering, Agentic AI development, and platform reliability into one cohesive delivery function.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and optimize end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model training, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Build, ship, and operationalize Agentic AI systems and large-scale ML workflows with a focus on automation, scalability, and reliability.
  • Develop and maintain robust platform engineering solutions to support high-performance ML/GenAI workloads.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Data Science, Engineering, Cloud Architecture) to deliver secure and high-quality systems.
  • Manage containerized AI workloads using Docker and Kubernetes for efficient orchestration and scaling.
  • Integrate ML pipelines into cloud and enterprise data ecosystems (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
  • Continuously improve system observability, model performance, and deployment automation.
  • Contribute to engineering best practices, reusable frameworks, and documentation to enable delivery excellence.
Required Skills & Experience
  • 7+ years of hands-on engineering experience across MLOps, DevOps, or Data Engineering with a strong focus on delivery and system build (not QA or management).
  • Proven track record building and shipping Agentic AI or ML systems in production environments.
  • Expert-level Python programming skills for production-grade system development.
  • Deep knowledge of ML lifecycle management, including model versioning, monitoring, and governance.
  • Strong expertise in Docker, Kubernetes, and related CI/CD tooling (GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD, etc.).
  • Experience implementing or extending GenAI frameworks (LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs, etc.) for enterprise use cases.
  • Solid understanding of cloud-native ML platforms such as AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI, or Azure ML.
  • Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, with experience in financial services or secure enterprise environments preferred.

job.title: RF Systems Engineer - SatCom (34588)
job.description:
In this role, the successful candidate will function as a subject-matter expert in satellite-based RF communications, with deep technical mastery at the physical and Layer 2 levels and a solid working knowledge of Layer 3 protocols and above. The position involves hands-on engagement with DVB-S2, DVB-S2X, and DVB-RCS2 standards, alongside a strong theoretical foundation in RF and communications systems. Experience with Adaptive Coding and Modulation, phased-array antenna concepts, digital beam forming, rapid beam hopping, and overall antenna performance modelling is essential. The individual will operate within a structured Systems Engineering framework, leveraging established processes and artifacts to guide projects from requirements definition through design, implementation, and verification.

Core Responsibilities

  • Evaluate and refine link budgets, conduct system-level trade studies, and model signal degradation factors to accurately simulate and assess communications system performance.

  • Collaborate with system architects, RF and antenna specialists, and ground station engineers to allocate functions between hardware and software components while optimizing overall system efficiency and performance.

  • Develop high-level technical specifications for RF links, antenna subsystems, and related components, while responding to evolving requirement changes. Prepare, review, and validate test plans, procedures, and outcomes to ensure adherence to defined specifications.

  • Measure, interpret, and report on system performance metrics, maintaining detailed performance budgets for critical system elements.

  • Provide expert technical input to regulatory, coordination, and market-access initiatives, and offer mentorship and technical leadership to junior engineers. Periodically prepare and deliver technical briefings or presentations to professional audiences.

Education & Professional Experience

  • Master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, with concentration in RF engineering, antenna or microwave theory, digital communications, and/or digital signal processing.

  • Minimum of 10 years of directly relevant professional experience aligned with the responsibilities outlined above.

  • Demonstrated background in digital communication systems including spread-spectrum methods, single- and multi-carrier architectures, and modulation techniques such as PSK, APSK, and QAM.

  • Practical experience with industry modulation standards including DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as hands-on use of Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) strategies.

  • Proven capability in modelling and simulating RF communication systems using advanced analytical tools such as Python, MATLAB, or equivalent platforms.

    $115000-$145000
