job.title: Data Scientist - AI, Analytics & Machine Learning (34638)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Scientist to join our analytics and AI team focused on driving data-driven decision-making across large-scale systems and telecommunications-related use cases. You will work on advanced data analytics, machine learning modeling, and statistical analysis to extract actionable insights, build predictive systems, and support strategic business and product decisions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze large, heterogeneous datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that support business and product strategy.

  • Design, develop, and deploy machine learning and statistical models to solve real-world problems (predictive analytics, classification, regression, clustering).

  • Work closely with product managers, data engineers, and cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable data science solutions.

  • Perform exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model evaluation.

  • Build data pipelines and integrate models into production systems where relevant.

  • Communicate insights and results clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders through visualizations and reports.

  • Stay current with emerging techniques in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science best practices.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related discipline.

  • Strong programming skills in Python and experience with data science libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).

  • Experience with machine learning modeling techniques, including supervised and unsupervised methods.

  • Solid statistical analysis skills and understanding of modeling assumptions and performance evaluation.

  • Experience working with large datasets and data engineering tools (e.g., SQL, Spark).

  • Ability to produce meaningful visualizations and presentations of analytical results.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Hadoop).

  • Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

  • Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) or experience with natural language processing.

  • Exposure to AI/ML model deployment workflows, MLOps tools, and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Experience with real-time streaming or event-driven analytics (e.g., Kafka).

job.title: Structural Revit Designer (34645)
job.description:
Structural Revit Designer
Location: Greenville, SC
$110k - $120k

About the Role

A growing engineering consultancy is seeking a skilled Structural Designer to join its expanding team. The ideal candidate will bring strong technical design experience using Revit and AutoCAD, with a focus on industrial and manufacturing facilities. This role will support multi-discipline project teams to deliver high-quality engineering design packages from concept through construction.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop structural design models and drawings in Revit and AutoCAD for steel, concrete, and foundation systems.

  • Support engineers in preparing detailed design packages for industrial and manufacturing projects.

  • Coordinate designs with other disciplines including architectural, mechanical, electrical, and process teams.

  • Assist in site layout, equipment foundation, and building structure design.

  • Review and update drawings based on engineering markups, redlines, and field changes.

  • Ensure all design work complies with applicable codes, standards, and project specifications.

What We’re Looking For

  • Structural design experience in an industrial or manufacturing environment.

  • Proficiency in Revit and AutoCAD required; experience with Navisworks, Plant 3D, ACC Docs, and SendTo preferred.

  • Knowledge of steel and concrete design standards and detailing practices.

  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, project-driven setting.

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

job.title: Sr. Electrical Engineer (34506)
job.description:
Location: Akron, OH (Hybrid – 3 days in office)
Job Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire
Schedule: Hybrid (on-site collaboration required)
Compensation: $130,000–$150,000 base salary
(Exempt/salaried role; additional compensation eligibility may apply for workload demands beyond standard hours)
 

Position Summary

The Senior Electrical Engineer is responsible for leading and executing electrical engineering design efforts for industrial projects. This role involves gathering and analyzing technical data, developing electrical designs, and supporting projects through construction and commissioning phases.

Typical project work includes power distribution, lighting systems, electrical one-line diagrams, load studies, protective relaying, arc flash studies, hazardous area classifications, and equipment specifications. The position requires periodic visits to client facilities and may include hands-on field support.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform electrical engineering calculations and develop detailed design packages

  • Lead and coordinate designers and engineers within a project team

  • Prepare electrical deliverables including:

    • Power and lighting systems

    • Electrical one-line drawings

    • Electrical load studies

    • Protective relaying and short-circuit studies

    • Arc flash studies

    • Area classifications

    • Control schematics and installation details

  • Specify electrical equipment such as:

    • Switchgear, transformers, MCCs, motors, UPS systems

    • Grounding and bonding systems

  • Utilize engineering and design software to complete assigned tasks efficiently

  • Serve as discipline lead on electrical-only projects by:

    • Estimating engineering hours

    • Defining scope of work

    • Recommending staffing needs

    • Reviewing and checking drawings

  • Support field activities including:

    • Installation reviews

    • Troubleshooting and problem-solving

    • Coordination with contractors and vendors

  • Maintain compliance with company policies, procedures, safety standards, and applicable codes

  • Promote safe work practices and identify potentially unsafe conditions

  • Perform additional duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from an ABET-accredited university

  • Professional Engineer (PE) license or an EIT who has met the requirements to take the PE and have at hand in a few month

  • Strong field experience in industrial environments

  • 12–30 years of experience in one or more of the following industries:

    • Chemicals

    • Petrochemicals

    • Polymers

    • Utilities

    • Energy

    • Manufacturing

  • Extensive experience with:

    • Hazardous Area Classifications (process industries)

    • Electrical power distribution systems

    • Protective relaying and short-circuit analysis

    • Arc flash analysis

  • Working knowledge of:

    • NEC / NFPA 70

    • NFPA 30

    • Applicable building and electrical codes

  • Proficiency in:

    • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

    • AutoCAD (3D preferred)

    • Revit

    • EasyPower or similar electrical modeling software

  • Experience interpreting and developing:

    • P&IDs

    • PFDs

    • Loop diagrams

    • Conduit, cable, and equipment schedules

job.title: MLOps Engineer – Machine Learning Operations & AI Infrastructure (34639)
job.description:
We are seeking a skilled MLOps Engineer to support the full lifecycle of machine learning and AI solutions in a large-scale, enterprise telecommunications environment. You will design, build, deploy, and automate reliable and scalable ML workflows across cloud and on-premises platforms, enabling data science and AI teams to deliver production-ready models efficiently. This role blends machine learning engineering, DevOps practices, and infrastructure expertise to operationalize AI solutions at scale.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines supporting model training, validation, deployment, monitoring, and automated retraining.

  • Collaborate with data scientists, AI developers, and software engineering teams to transition models from research to production.

  • Implement CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows, including automated testing and artifact management.

  • Manage model versioning, experiment tracking, and governance to ensure reproducibility and auditability.

  • Deploy and manage scalable model serving infrastructure using containerization and orchestration tools.

  • Monitor model performance, detect drift, and implement alerting and retraining strategies.

  • Optimize compute and storage infrastructure for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.

  • Document workflows, standards, and best practices related to ML lifecycle management.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.

  • 3+ years of experience in MLOps, DevOps, or ML Engineering roles.

  • Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with Java or similar languages is an asset.

  • Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

  • Deep understanding of CI/CD, automation tools, and infrastructure-as-code concepts.

  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and container orchestration.

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.

  • Experience building and maintaining production ML services and pipelines.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with MLOps and experiment-tracking tools such as MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow, or DVC.

  • Knowledge of feature stores, metadata management, and model governance frameworks.

  • Familiarity with hybrid cloud and on-prem deployment environments.

  • Understanding of security, compliance, and performance considerations for AI systems in enterprise settings.

  • Experience supporting AI/ML workloads in telecommunications, networking, or other large-scale distributed systems.

job.title: Piping Designer - AutoCAD Plant 3D (34582)
job.description:
Staff Mechanical Designer
Location: Charlotte, NC
Pay Range: $47.25 - $57.75 per hour
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)

Job Description

Perform various phases of planning, site evaluations, analytical designs, report preparation, specifications, and preparation of proposal and construction documentation and mechanical plans as part of a project team. This position will work on various projects with a diverse portfolio of project types and clients.   

Responsibilities
  • Perform a variety of assignments using prescribed methods and standard techniques including drawing sequence and presentation, incorporating various system components, and refining rough sketches. 
  • Follow all company, client and project design and drafting standards.
  • Produce complete PFDs and P&IDs from verbal or written description from the design engineer.
  • Produce complete plot plans, sections, and details from verbal or written description from the design engineer. Isometric experience a plus.
  • Execute basic formulas, principles and practices, and use acquired knowledge of fundamental concepts and practices pertaining to the mechanical discipline.
  • Plan and develop drawings for production work including problem analysis, design layout and calculations on non-routine assignments of substantial variety and complexity.
  • Execute variety of mechanical design assignments using prescribed methods and standard techniques including drawing sequence and presentation, sizing various system components and refining rough sketches.
  • Execute changes to designs or sketches and redlines or mark-ups on ongoing projects.
  • Analyze reports, drawings, and tests to plan and design projects.
  • Interpret and incorporate design codes and specifications related to design requirements.
  • Review design drawings for quality assurance within scope, budget and schedule. 
  • Perform projects tasks and assignments within budgeted hours and deadlines.
  • Compute calculations for layouts, equipment, wiring diagrams, and schematics.
  • Responsible for the revisions of project drawings, plot files and project-related information are stored in a logical and well-structured manner.
  • Responsible for clear and concise written and verbal communications, as it relates to the project client coordination.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor Degree in drafting technology or related field and min 7 years related experience is Required OR Associate Degree  and min 8 years related experience is Required OR High School and min 9 years progressive detailing and design experience is Required.  
  • Advanced understanding of design software such as: AutoCAD, Plant3D, and Excel to develop the design deliverables.
  • Familiarity with MicroStation and CadWorx a plus.
  • Ability to learn and effectively utilize new design software programs.  
  • Advanced ability to utilize both 2D and 3D applications to prepare engineering drawings. 
  • Familiarity and skill with geolocated models, plant coordinate systems, and other spatial baselines a must.
  • Knowledge in design, calculations and design systems.  
  • Knowledge in the theory and practices of assigned discipline; competent in the fundamental concepts of other disciplines as they relate to the assigned discipline; and capable of operating related discipline design software necessary to execute production tasks.  
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others including, but not limited to Project Managers, Engineers and Designers in a multi-discipline and multi-office project team environment to resolve design or drawing issues as appropriate and to accomplish objectives.  
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills.  
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, and attention to detail. 
  • Proven ability to manage multiple, competing projects and meet tight deadlines.

job.title: Sr Python Developer-W2 only (34663)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Lemont, IL is currently seeking a Python Developer-Federated Learning & Visualization for a 100% Remote contract position.

NOTE:  Must be a US Citizen.

TOP Required Qualifications:

  1. Strong experience with Python software development.
  2. Experience with Flask/WSGI, GitHub, Bash
  3. Experience with PyTorch, WandB, Pylint, Unit testing, CI/CD, and it would be a plus if familiar with any distributed training workflow (e.g., torch distributed, accelerated, deepspeed, etc.), and model inference hosting framework (e.g., vllm, ray, etc.).
  4. Experience with HPC, AWS/Google/Azure, Kubernetes.
  5. Proficiency in using cloud APIs to deploy applications and scale them is important
  6. Experience with federated learning or distributed training frameworks.
  7. Experience building dashboards, monitoring, or visualization tools.
  8. Familiarity with HPC, cloud, or hybrid compute environments.
  9. Prior contributions to open-source projects.
Job Summary:
Seeking a Python Software Engineer to support the development and maintenance of APPFL (Advanced Privacy-Preserving Federated Learning), an open-source framework for privacy-preserving federated learning used by national laboratories and academic research partners.
In this role, you will help design and build real-time dashboards and visualization tools that allow researchers to monitor and understand distributed machine-learning workflows. You will also contribute to improving the performance, reliability, and usability of the APPFL framework while supporting its open-source community.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Real-Time Federated Learning Visualization
    • Design and implement a real-time visualization and monitoring toolkit for federated/distributed learning workflows.
    • Build an extensible architecture to collect, aggregate, and visualize FL metrics across distributed clients and servers.
    • Support real-time or near-real-time tracking of training progress, client participation, system performance, and federated coordination events.
    • Visualize metrics such as training loss/accuracy, round progression, client participation and location, communication volume, latency, queue time, and resource utilization.
    • Ensure compatibility with HPC, cloud, and hybrid environments.
    • Provide clear APIs, configuration options, and user-facing documentation.
  • Privacy-Preserving Federated Learning Features
    • Implement privacy-preserving mechanisms for secure federated learning experiments.
    • Optimize memory footprints and communication patterns for large-scale experiments (large models and many clients).
    • Develop features such as distributed client trainers to support foundation model development using APPFL.
  • Framework Maintenance & Release Support
    • Investigate and resolve GitHub issues in a timely manner.
    • Refactor the codebase to improve robustness and user experience.
    • Update unit and integration tests.
    • Review community pull requests.
    • Support version releases, changelog preparation, and documentation updates.
  • Community & Ecosystem Development
    • Improve public documentation, tutorials, and example workflows.
    • Develop reproducible example use cases for demos and training.
    • Support community engagement and issue triage on GitHub.
    • Contribute to open-source governance, contribution guidelines, and developer documentation.

job.title: Structural Engineer (34646)
job.description:
Structural Engineer, PE
Location: Appleton, WI
Pay: $120k - $150k
Description: 

Who We Are

A growing engineering consultancy provides full-service engineering, procurement, and construction management (EPCm) services to industrial process manufacturers across multiple sectors including pulp & paper, chemical, consumer products, food & beverage, power, and heavy industrial markets nationwide. The organization is currently experiencing significant growth and offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and expanding team.

What You’ll Be Doing

This individual will design structures capable of withstanding stresses and pressures resulting from human use and environmental conditions. Responsibilities include designing and configuring structures, overseeing drawing production, selecting appropriate foundation, building, and equipment support materials, inspecting construction work, and ensuring the structural integrity of foundations and facilities.

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Prepare reports, design criteria, cost estimates, designs, and drawings

  • Perform calculations related to pressures, loads, and stresses

  • Provide technical guidance on safe structural design and construction

  • Obtain planning and/or building regulation approvals

  • Coordinate with clients and multidisciplinary professionals including architects and engineers

  • Monitor and inspect contractor work to ensure structural compliance and soundness

  • Administer small subcontracts and manage structural project scopes

  • Review geotechnical reports to evaluate site conditions and foundation requirements

  • Utilize computer-aided design software for modeling and simulation

Ideal Background

The successful candidate will bring a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset and a strong ability to collaborate across disciplines. The role requires strong communication skills and the ability to manage multiple projects and client relationships simultaneously.

Qualifications include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering

  • Licensed Professional Engineer (PE)

  • 3+ years of experience as a Structural Engineer

  • Experience in industrial structural engineering environments

  • Proficiency in STAAD, AutoCAD, and Revit

  • Experience with steel, concrete, and masonry design

  • Experience supporting heavy to light industrial projects

  • Familiarity with rotating equipment and vibration analysis

  • Advanced knowledge of construction methods, materials, and applicable regulations
